intro: Grimaldia fagonioides, commonly known as the Mexican sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Grimaldia fagonioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
